Success! Your Serverless Website is Live!

Deploying a secure and highly available static website using AWS S3, CloudFront, Route 53, and ACM.

Introduction

We've successfully deployed a static website using a stack of AWS services. In this guide, we'll share the steps and resources used to achieve this.

Architecture Overview

Our serverless website is built using the following AWS services:

  • Amazon S3: To host our static website.
  • Amazon CloudFront: To deliver the website content with low latency and high transfer speeds.
  • Amazon Route 53: To route traffic to our website by translating friendly domain names to IP addresses.
  • AWS Certificate Manager (ACM): To manage the SSL/TLS certificates for our website, ensuring secure communication.

Deployment Steps

  1. Setting up an S3 Bucket
  2. Configuring CloudFront Distribution
  3. Managing DNS using Route 53
  4. Securing the Website using ACM

Conclusion

With the right configuration and security practices, AWS services can provide a robust infrastructure for hosting static websites with global reach and SSL/TLS security.
